;;南极海狗发现越来越难找到磷虾来吃，结果，它们的数量急剧下降
;

;关于南极海洋环境的重要国际会议未能就新的保护区达成一致，尽管有证据表明南部大陆正面临一系列危机，包括海冰水平历史最低水平、野生动物数量锐减等建立近 400 万平方公里海洋保护区的长期提议并未得到一致支持，这主要是由于俄罗斯政府代表团的反对，该代表团因签证问题而迟到。据霍巴特会议上的多个消息来源称，相关的延误，然后讨论一再陷入停滞。

;

;由于无法达成重大协议，会议;位于霍巴特的南极海洋生物资源保护委员会;将有关南极半岛西部、威德尔海和南极洲东部附近保护区提案的辩论推迟到明年。< /p>;

;

;;相关：;;“灾难性”：禽流感首次到达南极;

;
;

;观察员称，为期两周的会议26 个国家政府和欧盟收到了科学证据，表明保护区需要保护企鹅、齿鱼、海豹和鲸鱼的重要觅食和繁殖地，并达到;全球商定的保护 30% 的目标到 2030 年，世界自然基金会南极洲保护经理艾米丽·格里利 (Emily Grilly) 表示，经过十多年的讨论和一年来前所未有的变化，没有取得重大进展，这“非常令人失望”。南极洲。

;
    ;
  • ;

    ;;;报名参加澳大利亚卫报的免费早间活动和每日新闻摘要的下午电子邮件通讯;;

    ;
    • ;
;

;“;海冰含量创历史新低; ;帝企鹅的灾难性繁殖失败;应该给各国敲响警钟，让各国团结起来，优先考虑保护工作，并兑现建立具有重要禁渔区的[海洋保护区]的承诺，”她说。

;

;该委员会——被称为;Ccamlr;（发音为“camelar”）——是根据一项国际条约成立的自 1982 年以来一直在澳大利亚最南端的塔斯马尼亚州举行会议。会议只是偶尔取得成功，最引人注目的是 2016 年达成的突破性协议 ;在罗斯海创建世界上最大的海洋公园;。南大洋约占全球海洋的 10%，但其中只有 5% 受到保护。

;
;

;;相关：;;“灾难性”：禽流感首次抵达南极< /a>;

;
;

;今年的会议以美国驻澳大利亚大使卡罗琳·肯尼迪 (Caroline Kennedy) 的开幕致辞拉开序幕，她敦促委员会“满足全球采取行动的需求”，此前;南极半岛的冰融化;，周围海冰数量空前减少大陆和;南极毛皮海狗种群崩溃;。会议期间透露，禽流感首次抵达南极洲，;引发人们对本已脆弱的环境中繁殖失败的担忧;。

;

;在接受采访时，肯尼迪告诉《卫报》，禽流感正在不断增长。人们认识到南大洋磷虾对世界粮食安全的重要性，并强调了对磷虾数量增加四倍的担忧过去15年的捕获量;。磷虾营养丰富，作为蛋白质来源和用于养鱼场饲料的需求不断增加。几乎所有南极动物物种的饮食都直接或间接依赖于它。

;

;“可以毫不夸张地说，南极磷虾对地球上的生命至关重要，为其可持续管理制定标准是非常重要的。肯尼迪对代表们说：“这是你们最大的责任之一。”

;
;
;

;感觉我们在南极海洋保护方面向前迈了一步，又退了两步

;
; ;南极与南大洋联盟执行主任克莱尔·克里斯蒂安;
;
;
;

;俄罗斯代表团错过了肯尼迪的演讲和重大科学报告的吹风会。到达后，它反对加强环境保护的提议。会议陷入加班，于周五连夜结束，委员会的科学委员会同意于 7 月举行一次研讨会，重点讨论建立南极半岛西部海洋保护区和实施基于生态系统的磷虾渔业方法。

;

;南极和南大洋联盟执行董事克莱尔·克里斯蒂安表示，关键的保护措施没有被取消确实令人感到安慰，但该委员会在应该做出雄心勃勃的决定时却采取了行动。她说：“感觉我们在南极海洋保护方面向前迈进了一步，又倒退了两步。”

;
;

;;相关：;;帝企鹅：南极洲数千只小鸡因创纪录的低海冰水平而死亡;

;
;

;皮尤慈善信托基金的安德里亚·卡瓦纳 (Andrea Kavanagh) 表示，海洋保护区不会阻止气候危机，但将有助于使南大洋生态系统更具弹性。她说，科学家估计，由于海冰提前融化，2022 年繁殖季节可能有 9000 只帝企鹅幼崽死亡。她说，再过两年这样的情况可能会使该物种灭绝。 “如果 Ccamlr 不采取任何行动，这样的赛季还会持续多少个？”卡瓦纳说。

;

;澳大利亚环境部长塔尼娅·普利伯塞克 (Tanya Plibersek) 表示，令人失望的是，“尽管得到了许多成员的压倒性多数支持”，会议仍未达成一致。 “我们将继续与委员会合作，更好地保护南大洋和以此为家的珍贵海洋生物，”她说。

; Sun, 29 Oct 2023 13:22:02 +0800 Matthew Perry, actor best known for Friends, dies at 54 – reportshttps://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2023/oct/29/matthew-perry-death-friends-actor
;;2023-10-29T01:15:54Z;
;
;;2016 年的 Matthew Perry。
;

;Matthew Perry，因在热门影片中扮演钱德勒·宾而闻名据报道，电视情景喜剧《老友记》已去世，享年 54 岁。

;

;佩里; ;在洛杉矶太平洋帕利塞兹的家中溺水身亡，消息来源包括演员和执法部门的代表< a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/matthew-perry-friends-actor-dies-apparent-drowning-54-rcna122643">;告诉 NBC 新闻; 。其他美国媒体也报道了佩里去世的消息。

;

;在《成长的烦恼》、《比佛利山庄 90210》和《Dream On》中扮演小角色后，佩里于 1994 年在 NBC 情景喜剧《老友记》中获得了一个角色。这部喜剧讲述了六个朋友住在纽约的故事《约克城》迅速成为一种现象，赢得多项艾美奖并创下收视纪录。

;

;佩里在 10 季中继续扮演讽刺和神经质的钱德勒，2004 年的大结局在美国吸引了超过 5200 万观众，使这是 2000 年代收视率最高的电视剧。

;

;“每天都有人来找我说，‘嘿，钱德勒！’我不会对此做出回应，”他在 2014 年接受采访时说道。 “如果有人说，‘嗨，马修，我喜欢你的工作’，那是一回事。但如果有人说“哟，钱德勒”，我不喜欢那样。我厌倦了。我不是钱德勒。”

;
;

;;相关：;;毒品、阳痿和殴打贾斯汀·特鲁多：我们从马修·佩里的回忆录中学到的东西;< /p>;

;

;佩里 1969 年出生于马萨诸塞州，父亲是美国人，母亲是加拿大人，后来担任加拿大总理皮埃尔·特鲁多的新闻助理。佩里在 2022 年畅销回忆录《朋友、恋人和可怕的大事》中回忆起父亲为了追求自己的演员梦想而抛弃家庭后的行为，包括欺负年轻的贾斯汀·特鲁多。 “当他被任命负责整个军队时，我决定结束与他的争论，”他写道。

;

;15 岁时，佩里搬到了好莱坞，希望能与父亲重新建立联系。正是在那里，他开始喜欢上表演，并最终在一家餐馆被导演威廉·里彻特发现，“迷住了一群年轻女性”，并留下了一张纸条，邀请他出演下一部电影。

;

;佩里与里弗·菲尼克斯一起出演了里奇特的电影《吉米·里尔登的一夜》；七年后，这位年轻演员在毒蛇室去世，对佩里来说是毁灭性的打击。 “倒下的似乎总是那些真正有才华的人，”他在回忆录中写道。 “为什么瑞凡·菲尼克斯、希斯·莱杰这样的原创思想家都去世了，而基努·里维斯却依然行走在我们中间？”他后来向里夫斯道歉，称他的名字是随机选择的。

;

;佩里开始扮演钱德勒时才 24 岁，相对来说还不太出名，就像他的搭档詹妮弗·安妮斯顿、柯特妮·考克斯、丽莎·库卓、马特一样。勒布朗和大卫·史维默。在 2019 年的一次采访中，《老友记》的创作者大卫·克兰 (David Crane) 表示，钱德勒是最难选的角色；演员克雷格·比尔科 (Craig Bierko)、乔恩·克莱尔 (Jon Cryer) 和乔恩·法夫罗 (Jon Favreau) 也曾被考虑出演该角色。

;

;“玛塔（共同创作者考夫曼）和我都认为钱德勒写得不好，”克兰补充道。 “然后马修进来了，你就说，‘哦，好吧，就这样吧。完毕。完毕。就是这个人。”

;

;在《老友记》期间，佩里主演的电影包括与萨尔玛·海耶克合作的《傻瓜闯入》、与内芙·坎贝尔合作的《三人探戈》以及与布鲁斯·威利斯合作的《整九码》。他还在《甜心俏佳人》和《实习医生风云》中扮演过小角色。

;

;在 2002 年的;《卫报》的芭芭拉·艾伦; 称《朋友、恋人和可怕的大事》“令人痛苦，揭示了极端复合成瘾与超级名人碰撞的时刻”。他在书中写道：“你必须出名才能知道这不是答案。没有名气的人不会真正相信这一点。”

; Sun, 29 Oct 2023 09:52:02 +0800 South Africa beat New Zealand to win men’s Rugby World Cup finalhttps://www.theguardian.com/sport/2023/oct/28/south-africa-beat-new-zealand-to-win-mens-rugby-world-cup-final
;;2023-10-28T21:11:20Z;
;
;;终场哨声响起后，南非队的杰西·克里尔 (Jesse Kriel) 庆祝他的球队击败新西兰队，卫冕橄榄球世界杯。
;

;到目前为止，还没有人曾四次赢得男子橄榄球世界杯冠军。而且，即使是在一个潮湿的巴黎夜晚，这确实给人一种真正重要时刻的感觉。南非再次成为冠军，任何关于地球上最具统治力的橄榄球国家的争论都可以暂时平息。

;

;这是一场多么史诗般的拉锯比赛啊。这也将作为两位队长的故事而被人们铭记。四年前，南非首位黑人橄榄球队长西雅·科利西 (Siya Kolisi) 在日本举起韦伯·埃利斯杯 (Webb Ellis Cup) 时，这是这项运动中最令人难忘的画面之一，而现在，对于每一位跳羚队的支持者来说，都有一种似曾相识的辉煌感觉。对于他的全黑队对手萨姆·凯恩来说，这是最黑暗的夜晚。

;

;在凯恩因对杰西的直立铲断而被罚下场之前，球队几乎没有任何分歧。第27分钟，克里尔上场。曾经有过更糟糕的铲球，但一旦使用“高度危险”这个词，通常就只有一种结果。此前从未有球员在世界杯决赛中被罚下场，更不用说全黑队队长了。

;
;

;;相关：;;2023 年橄榄球世界杯决赛：新西兰 VS 南方非洲 – 现场;

;
;

;然而，这场令人心碎的戏剧还远未结束。半场结束后不久，科利西也因与阿迪·萨维亚的头球接触而被出示黄牌，鼓励新西兰队发起疯狂反击。全黑队的半场得分由争球亚伦·史密斯（Aaron Smith）因萨维亚（Savea）在进攻中的撞倒而被淘汰，但随后在比赛开始前通过博登·巴雷特（Beauden Barrett）打进一记合法的射门，为看台终结比赛，而他的兄弟乔迪（Jordie）则缺席了比赛比赛还剩七分钟时，他尝试了一次远距离点球。

;

;站在看台上的两位网球史上最伟大的球员罗杰·费德勒和诺瓦克·德约科维奇一定会同情角斗士的战斗。跳羚队凭借汉德烈·波拉德 (Handré Pollard) 出色的踢球能力和全能的彼得·斯蒂芬·杜托伊特 (Pieter-Steph du Toit) 再现了 2019 年世界足球先生的状态，他们从未止步，成为继 2015 年新西兰队之后的第二支男子球队。保住世界桂冠。

;

;总是会雷鸣般的。这两个非常自豪的国家已经进行橄榄球联盟比赛 102 年了，但有些比赛的规模比其他比赛更大。你可以在南非球员高唱国歌时的脸上看到这一点，也可以在哈卡战舞期间新西兰人专注的眼神中看到这一点。

;

;哭泣的天空让这种感觉更加强烈。别管雅克·尼纳伯了，赛前的大雨会让雅克·库斯托有宾至如归的感觉。对于新西兰来说，球打滑可能是个坏消息。更多的溢出就等于更多的争吵。正如英格兰队所证明的那样，南非队绝对喜欢争抢。此外，在巴雷特进球之前，跳羚队在三届世界杯决赛中从未失球。

; ;

;无论哪种方式，全黑队的比赛计划都很简单。尽早取得领先，压制博克替补席并施加记分牌压力。在埃本·埃泽贝斯 (Eben Etzebeth) 和他的同事们有机会从比赛中挤出生机的日子之前。

;

;然而，在比赛中，一切都没有完全按计划进行，特别是对于妓女邦吉·姆博纳比 (Bongi Mbonambi) 来说，她在仅仅三分钟后就一瘸一拐地下场了，香农·弗里泽尔（Shannon Frizell）扭转、摔倒的铲球的受害者，慢动作看起来不太好。这迫使南非队重新启用 37 岁的德昂·富里 (Deon Fourie)，并为姆博纳比 (Mbonambi) 艰难的个人周画上句号。

;

;南非队早期的领土优势为波拉德带来了两个点球，但随着弗里泽尔的回归，全黑队萨维亚加强了进攻，几乎达到了乔迪·巴雷特（Jordie Barrett）灵巧的小进攻切入点。不过，除了里奇·莫翁加 (Richie Mo'unga) 的点球之外，新西兰队无法取得太多进展，而波拉德 (Pollard) 在对阵英格兰队时，踢出了一记精彩的长踢，帮助球队恢复了 6 分的优势。

;

;全黑队需要为了保持冷静，但相反，他们的冷静暂时开始变得不稳定。令人沮丧的是，几名争边球队员误入歧途，很快，由于凯恩的不检点行为，他们的人数又回到了 14 人。另一端则是南非队，并赢得了失误点球，当凯恩不会回归的消息传出时，波拉德正在排队。踢球结束了，新西兰队迎面而来。

; ;

;在男子橄榄球世界杯决赛中，从未有过半场落后的球队获胜，在 12-6 落后的情况下，博克队的防守并没有落空。全黑队灵巧的中场配合。科利西离开后，比赛的势头再次发生了变化，新西兰队拒绝了可踢的点球而进入角球，当马克·特莱阿在左侧找到了一点空间，他的卸载被判定为角球时，他们应得的回报在博登·巴雷特 (Beauden Barrett) 铲球得分之前，他们已经向后反弹。

;

;最后一节同样令人喘不过气来，甚至在七分钟后切斯林·科尔贝 (Cheslin Kolbe) 因故意击倒而被送进垃圾箱之前。这并不是一场完全完美的锦标赛——时间过长，有时甚至令人沮丧地不平衡——但最好的比赛和你希望看到的任何运动一样引人注目。在南非，他们现在可以享受终极的荣耀。北半球 - 十次夺得世界杯冠军 - 仍有大量工作要做。

; Sun, 29 Oct 2023 00:52:01 +0800 ‘We will heal together’: Maine residents relieved as suspected gunman found deadhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/28/maine-shootings-residents-relieved-suspect-dead
;;2023-10-28T13:58:21Z;
;
;;A flag at half-mast near a recycling facility where law enforcement found the body of Robert Card, the suspect in this week's mass shootings.
;

;The terrified residents of Lewiston, Maine, woke up to a sense of some relief amid their shock and grief on Saturday after the “armed and dangerous” gunman who had kept them on lockdown since killing 18 people on Wednesday was found dead.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Maine shootings: gunman suspected of killing 18 people found dead;

;
;

;The body of suspected shooter Robert Card, 40, was found on Friday evening near a recycling area 10 miles from Lewiston, with what the authorities said was an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

;

;Announcing late on Friday that the massive local, county, state and federal hunt for Card was over, Maine's governor, Janet Mills, said she was “breathing a sigh of relief tonight knowing Card is no longer a threat to anyone”.

;

;“Tonight the people of Lewiston and the state of Maine begin to move forward on what will be a long and difficult road to healing. But we will heal together,” Mills said.

;

;Senator Susan Collins said that Maine residents could now “breathe a collective sigh of relief”.

;

;“To the families who lost loved ones and to those injured by this attack, I know that no words can diminish the shock, pain and justifiable anger you feel,” she said. “It is my hope that you will find solace and strength in knowing that you are in the hearts of people throughout Maine and across the nation.”

;

;The commissioner of Maine's department of public safety, Michael Sauschuck, said the suspect's body was discovered on Friday evening near the Androscoggin River in Lisbon Falls, just a few miles from Lewiston, where 18 people were fatally gunned down at a bowling alley and restaurant and 13 others wounded in the worst such massacre the state has ever witnessed.

;

;In Lewiston, there was an almost immediate sense of the community being able to exhale after a tense and terrifying three days with the gunman on the loose. Stores have been closed, with few people on the streets while hundreds of police searched rivers, woods and homes for Card. Officials announced that the Maine hunting season for the public would open on Saturday as scheduled.

;

;“The search is over for Mr Card. The caution is over. Hunting may resume,” stated an alert to residents that went out late on Friday.

;

;Attention will now turn to comforting and assisting the families of those killed in the attack on Just-in-Time Recreation bowling alley and Schemengees Bar & Grille, supporting those injured, of whom seven were still in the hospital on Saturday morning, and laying to rest the dead.

;

;Those killed ranged in age from 14 to 76 and included staff at the establishments, parents, children, members of the local deaf community out for a games night, and several heroes who called for help and tried to stop the gunman.

;

;“It's been one the scariest things I've ever had to go through,” said Elizabeth Bean, 18, who said she and her family had only left their home once since the shooting – to get groceries. “We didn't want to risk it. So it's been really sad.”

;

;During the manhunt, there was also a focus on Card's mental health history. He had been taken by police for an evaluation after military officials became concerned that he was acting erratically in mid-July, a US official told the Associated Press.

;

;The official said that commanders in the army reserve's third battalion, 304th infantry regiment became concerned in mid-July that Card was acting erratically while the unit was training at the military academy in West Point in New York.

;

;The official said military commanders became concerned about Card's safety and asked for the police to be called. New York state police took Card to the Keller army community hospital at West Point for evaluation, the official said.

;

;With the conclusion of the manhunt, Sauschuck said the hunting restriction that had been put in place was now lifted.

;

;Noah Caron, 17, said he felt that Lewiston could now start to grieve. “It was good to see how the community came together and kept everyone close,” he said.

;

;Lisbon's police chief, Ryan McGee, echoed that sentiment. “We have a great community and it's going to stick together,” he said.

;

;“It's been dark and scary,” said a woman, who gave her name as Monica, and whose husband's truck had been inaccessible near the waste station. “Now the light can begin to come back through.”

;

;It was the worst gun massacre in the US so far this year and prompted Joe Biden to reiterate his strong calls for a ban on assault weapons for the general public, such as the gun used by Card.

;

;It ;also motivated; a Democratic congressman from Maine, who had opposed calls for a ban on assault rifles throughout all the previous mass shootings in the US since the last ban expired in 2004, to change tack after murder came to his home town.

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 22:22:01 +0800 Rishi Sunak to ‘double down’ on anti-green policies in king’s speechhttps://www.theguardian.com/politics/2023/oct/28/rishi-sunak-to-double-down-on-anti-green-policies-in-kings-speech
;;2023-10-28T11:18:51Z;
;
;;Rishi Sunak
;

;Rishi Sunak's government will use next week's king's speech to advance expansion of North Sea oil and gas exploration, as well as pro-car policies, in the hope of opening up a clear divide over the green agenda with Labour, the ;Observer; understands.

;

;Energy industry sources and senior figures in Whitehall say they expect ministers to announce legislation to usher in a new annual system for awarding oil and gas licences, despite the UK's commitments to move away from fossil fuels and reach net zero carbon emissions by 2050.

;

;The king's speech, the final legislative programme before the next general election, is also expected to include measures that will explicitly favour motorists, including making it more difficult for local authorities to introduce 20mph speed limits or supposedly unpopular schemes such as the ultra-low emission zone (Ulez), recently expanded in London.

;

;Laws to bring in tougher sentencing for serious crimes including rape, and moves to allow the government to rent prison space abroad to ease the current problems of overcrowding are also expected.

;

;With his party lagging way behind Labour in the polls, Sunak announced ;a major U-turn on green policy in September;, postponing the deadline for selling new petrol and diesel cars and the phasing out of gas boilers, prompting fury from the car and energy industries. He hoped to win over voters worried that green policies would add to the cost of living.

;

;But since relaunching his premiership and axing the Birmingham to Manchester leg of HS2, the Tories have made no progress. In today's Opinium poll for the ;Observer,; they remain 15 points adrift of Keir Starmer's party.

;

;Despite this, Whitehall insiders and the energy industry say there are now clear signs that Sunak intends to double down in the hope that he can create “wedge issues” with Labour.

;

;Labour suspects the king's speech will be packed full of bills that will be there almost entirely for political reasons. One senior opposition figure said: “Many of these are not bills that are even necessary, nor does the government think they will ever come on to the statute book. They will be there because they want to be able to ask us: do you dare oppose this or not?”

;

;Environmental campaigners point out that more oil and gas exploration licences are not only irresponsible, given the climate crisis, but that new laws are not needed to award more licences. This has been shown by the fact that the results of a new round of licences, launched just over a year ago during Liz Truss's brief stint as PM, are due to be announced imminently.

; ;

;The government argues that awarding more licences will enhance the UK's energy security and reduce dependence on higher-emission imports, while protecting more than 200,000 jobs in a vital industry.

;

;But the plans have been cast into doubt by new analysis that shows that 13 years of North Sea licensing under the Tories has led to the discovery of very small amounts of gas, the equivalent of just nine weeks' worth of typical usage across the country.

;

;New data from Uplift – an NGO that supports the transition from fossil fuel production – shows that hundreds of North Sea licences have been issued in six rounds since the Conservatives came to power in 2010. However, this has led to the discovery of only five new oil and gas fields and enabled a further seven previously discovered fields to be developed.

;

;These 12 new fields contain just nine weeks of gas, but only half have begun producing. To date, just 16 days worth of gas has been produced from them since 2010. And half of this has been produced by the Sillimanite gas field, which is 30%-owned by Russian gas giant Gazprom, and has been exported to the Netherlands.

;

;After five decades of drilling, the North Sea's dwindling reserves, which are largely (70%) oil, mean significant new discoveries are unlikely.

;

;Tessa Khan, executive director of Uplift, said: “Over the past 13 years under this government, new licences – hundreds of them – have lead to a couple of months' worth of new gas being discovered, and only just over a fortnight's worth actually being produced.

;

;“The Conservatives are selling us a pipe dream when they need to be straight with people about how we're going to power this country. Rather than coming up with a coherent plan for ensuring we have a secure and, crucially, affordable power supply, they're trying to score political points.

;

;“An estimated 6 million households in this country now can't afford to heat their homes in winter, and bills are likely to stay high for the rest of the decade. Does this government care, or is it more concerned with playing political games with energy policy?”

;A 16-year-old Iranian girl has died after an alleged encounter with officers over violating the country's hijab law, state media and activists have said.

;Iran has denied that Armita Geravand was hurt after a confrontation on 1 October with officers enforcing the mandatory Islamic dress code in the Tehran metro. She had been ;pronounced brain dead; last week after falling into a coma on 1 October.

;

;Human rights groups were the first to make Armita's hospitalisation public, posting photos on social media that showed her unconscious and on life support, with a respiratory tube and her head bandaged. Reuters could not verify the pictures.

;

;On Saturday, the official IRNA news agency reported Armita had died, and a Norwegian rights group, Hengaw, confirmed it had received a report confirming her death. The Guardian has not independently verified the reports.

;

;IRNA reported: “Unfortunately, she went into a coma for some time after suffering from brain damage. She died a few minutes ago.”

;

;On its website, Hengaw, which was founded in 2016 to report on human rights violations in the Kurdish areas of Iran, said Garavand had “tragically passed away”.

;

;The ;death of Mahsa Amini;, 22, in the custody of morality police last September sparked months of anti-government protests that spiralled into the biggest show of opposition to Iranian authorities in years.

;

;Women are legally required to cover their hair and wear long, loose-fitting clothes in Iran, where the secular and western-backed Shah was deposed in a revolution in 1979.

;

;Violators face public rebuke, fines or arrest, yet increasing numbers of women have been appearing unveiled in public places, such as restaurants and shops, since Amini's death.
